alert.note: Alert for Saipan; Tinian (Marianas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued May 25 at 9:11AM ChST until May 26 at 6:00PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 FRIDAY ALONG SOUTH AND WEST FACING REEFS... ...HIGH RISK OF RIP CURRENTS THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM THIS EVENING... * WHAT...High Surf Warning, dangerously large breaking waves of 10 to 15 feet in the surf zone along south and west facing reefs. Expect life-threatening rip currents. For the Coastal Flood Warning, significant coastal flooding and erosion is likely due to high surf from Mawar. * WHERE...Saipan and Tinian. * WHEN...For the High Surf Warning and High Rip Current Risk, until 6 PM Friday. For the Coastal Flood Warning, until 6 PM this evening. * IMPACTS...Breaking waves can sweep people off jetties and docks, and into dangerous seas. Life-threatening swimming conditions and significant beach erosion can be expected. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. Shoreline erosion will occur along with the possibility of inundation for coastal properties.
info.instruction: Stay out of the water. Everyone should remain out of the water due to life-threatening surf conditions. Stay off of piers and other waterside infrastructure. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth.
